issues.description: The solution defines the Lecture constructor with package-private visibility (no access modifier) while the problem statement asks students to "Create a constructor" without specifying visibility. This can be confusing and may prevent students/tests outside the package from instantiating Lecture (e.g., unit tests in a different package), since a package-private constructor is not accessible outside de.tum.cit.ase. The template leaves the constructor as a TODO (no signature), so there is no explicit guidance to students that the constructor should be public. To avoid accidental accessibility problems and align with typical expectations (public constructor for instantiation), the constructor should be declared public.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor public in both template and solution to match common expectations and ensure visibility from other packages. For example change the constructor declaration to: public Lecture(String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors) { ... } and update the template's TODO to show the public constructor signature so students implement the same.
